channel.title: More pc help.. <Because i don't ask enough questions already
channel.description:
So I bought a used pc "Probably not my best idea" I bought one because my laptop just fried after replacing the hard disk and all that well now this pc is not having any issues but really bad slowness and idk why
[img]http://i1107.photobucket.com/albums/h381/raylaw1/Screenshot_1_zps7vzvr8vb.png[/img]
The pc has 2gb of ram in it right now. Both good sticks. My problem is it says I only have a 1gb stick in it. Note: "Im Running Windows Vista Home Premium 32 bit" The fan has a really bad and really loud buzzing one of the fins got broke on it. So i put a piece of metal under it to quiet it down a little bit Could that be my problem? Cause i honestly have no idea and i should probably stop buying pc's from the same person :palm: But could any of you help me?
Pc specs:
Intel pentium 4 3.2ghz (HT) Technology 2 gbs of ram "only shows 1" 150gb solid state drive and a 750gb western digital IDE Hard Disk 1gb Nvidia Geforce 8400 GS
Oh and i seem to have another problem with a person on the forums was wondering if there was any way to block this
[img]http://i1107.photobucket.com/albums/h381/raylaw1/Screenshot_2_zpsd0nlnpmc.png[/img]
Thanks for your help :)

item.title: More pc help.. <Because i don't ask enough questions already
item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

[quote=“Muroth, post:7, topic:550511”][quote author=google link=topic=669421.msg4476545#msg4476545 date=1426212016]

The problem could be the fact you’re using Vista. Vista sucks, either downgrade to Windows XP, upgrade to Windows 7, or install a linux flavor.

Well i ran malwarebytes and the slowness went away. and i even took it apart and cleaned everything and still only 1gb. But my speakers are making funny noises now and it isn’t my amp nor my sub. So idk anymore and i will sell it someone dumber then me
[/quote]

Does BIOS show 2GB of RAM?[/quote]

Yup, Its probably vista they guy said he bought it with vista on it and the only thing he changed was the hard drives. Everything else when in it when he bought it new.

Read full topic

Does BIOS show 2GB of RAM?

item.source: More pc help.. <Because i don't ask enough questions already

item.title: More pc help.. <Because i don't ask enough questions already
item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:2, topic:550511”]Did you try checking to make sure the RAM stick was fully plugged in? Also how did you check to see if the RAM stick was still ok? Did you try switching the RAM sticks around to see if it could be a MOBO problem? Did you have to buy this POS computer? All these questions and more!

Also either report the person or ignore them.

Check to make sure you can only get messages from users that aren’t on your ignore list. You can do that by going to My Messages > Change Settings > receive messages from:. Change it and hit save. Next go to Profile > Buddy/ignore list > Add user > Profit++.[/quote]

Thanks, and yeah i switched them around and they both work. and

Did you have to buy this POS computer?
Probably shouldn’t have but i was desperate but both ram sticks are fully plugged in. so idk what the problem is I’ve been looking all night

:EDIT: After diggin so long I’m pretty sure its the mother board and since im broke. Im just going to buy a 2gb stick and put it in the working slot. And also the CPU has been runnig at 210 Degrees so and I’m pretty sure that isn’t good. Video card is fine everything else is fine the pc is really fast when you first start it but after using it for about 3 1/2 hours gets a little slow and frustrating but i found a Temporary fix for now until i can buy a new pc that has never been used and next time i see that guy im going to kill him

Read full topic
item.source: More pc help.. <Because i don't ask enough questions already

item.title: More pc help.. <Because i don't ask enough questions already
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Did you try checking to make sure the RAM stick was fully plugged in? Also how did you check to see if the RAM stick was still ok? Did you try switching the RAM sticks around to see if it could be a MOBO problem? Did you have to buy this POS computer? All these questions and more!

Also either report the person or ignore them.

Check to make sure you can only get messages from users that aren’t on your ignore list. You can do that by going to My Messages > Change Settings > receive messages from:. Change it and hit save. Next go to Profile > Buddy/ignore list > Add user > Profit++.

Read full topic
